docs.title: Action
docs.description: Action is the way to perform writes in the system. The configuration determines what code is generated and the developer is able to further customize as needed.

docs.title: Action Only Fields
docs.description: Allows configuring other fields to be added in the input of an Action.

docs.title: Add Edge Action
docs.description: This is done via the ActionOperation.AddEdge operation.

docs.title: Builder
docs.description: The Builder is the building block for Actions. Even though Action provides the ability to restrict the fields and edges that are exposed to external clients, developers should still have the full power to mutate the object as they see fit.

docs.title: Create Action
docs.description: This is done via the ActionOperation.Create or ActionOperation.Mutations operation.

docs.title: Delete Action
docs.description: This is done via the ActionOperation.Delete or ActionOperation.Mutations operation.

docs.title: Edge Group Action
docs.description: This is done via the ActionOperation.EdgeGroup operation.

docs.title: Edit Action
docs.description: This is done via the ActionOperation.Edit or ActionOperation.Mutations operation.

docs.title: Input
docs.description: Most Actions have an Input associated with them. This is generated based on how the action is configured.

docs.title: Observers
docs.description: Observers allow for coordinating changes that shouldn't be made within the same transaction as the write.

docs.title: Permissions
docs.description: To control who can perform an action, a Privacy Policy is used.

docs.title: Remove Edge Action
docs.description: This is done via the ActionOperation.RemoveEdge operation.

docs.title: Triggers
docs.description: Triggers allows for coordinating other changes that should be made at the same time within the same transaction. No actual write should be made within the trigger. Changes should be queued up as needed within the trigger.

docs.title: Validators
docs.description: Sometimes you need more than per-field validation in an action and Validators associated with an action enables that.

docs.title: Viewer For Ent Load
docs.description: After an action is performed, often the object is reloaded as follows:

docs.title: Authentication
docs.description: Authentication is a very complicated topic and we're not going to dive too deep into all that it entails here.

docs.title: Context
docs.description: Context is a simple object that represents, well, the context of what's happening.

docs.title: Context Caching
docs.description: To speed up applications, we end up caching data in memory to avoid repeated trips to the database. Since we create a new Context per request, we depend on the context cache (if available).

docs.title: Ent
docs.description: The Ent represents a single node in the graph. Generated from the schema, it can be configured as needed based on the application.

docs.title: Ent Query
docs.description: Ent Query is the way to query for edge data, counts, or the ents at the end of the edge. It provides pagination and eventually ordering, filtering and custom ways to slice the data. We currently have two types of EntQueries:

docs.title: Privacy Policy
docs.description: The PrivacyPolicy is used to apply permission checks on an object. It's used in Ents and Actions.

docs.title: Viewer
docs.description: Viewer represents who's viewing the content in your product or app. Every time data is loaded or changed, the Viewer is required to determine if that action can be performed.

docs.title: Custom Accessors
docs.description: We briefly showed how to add custom functionality in an object but didn't show how to expose it in GraphQL to end users. This explains how to do so.

docs.title: Custom Mutations
docs.description: As a product gets more complicated, the need to eventually add custom mutations to the schema arises. This shows how to do so.

docs.title: Custom Queries
docs.description: As a product gets more complicated, adding custom queries to the schema becomes essential. This shows how to do so.

docs.title: File Uploads
docs.description: Uploading files is a common of part of applications and we need a way to support that.

docs.title: gqlArg
docs.description: gqlArg annotates an argument to a method to indicate that it's an argument of a GraphQL field.

docs.title: gqlContextType
docs.description: gqlContextType annotates a method to indicate that it needs the RequestContext and the generated GraphQL code should pass it down to the method.

docs.title: gqlField
docs.description: gqlField annotates a property or method to indicate that it should be exposed as a GraphQL Field on the source object.

docs.title: Actions
docs.description: Actions are the way to configure writes in the system. Instead of just a blanket create, edit and delete option, we believe it makes more sense to have more nuanced options.

docs.title: Constraints
docs.description: This allows configuring constraints in the database

docs.title: Edge Groups
docs.description: Edge Groups provide the ability to group a related collection of edges together.

docs.title: Edges
docs.description: Edges provide the ability to express connections between nodes in the graph. They allow a standardized way to indicate a relationship.

docs.title: Enums
docs.description: Enums can be configured in three different ways.

docs.title: Fields
docs.description: A field represents each unique item that's part of the object. Each implementation of field configures its representation in the database, TypeScript generated code, and in GraphQL.

docs.title: Indices
docs.description: This allows configuring indices in the database.

docs.title: Patterns
docs.description: Patterns are shared objects for reusable concepts across schemas.

docs.title: Schema
docs.description: The Schema is the core building block that's used to configure each node in the product.

docs.title: Ent Intro
docs.description: The Ent framework was created to free up time for engineers and teams to focus on what's different about their app as opposed to spending time rebuilding the same cruft that's common across different projects.
